page.title: 17Land Use Around Saltford
page.content: Our route took us along the northern boundary of the school playing field, which is marked by a chain-link fence. We noticed that this extended all round the field although it was rein- forced by a hedge along its southern side beside the B3116. The path we took was overgrown with grass and stinging nettles.We soon reached a stream where the bushes grew thickly.We crossed the stream by means of a wooden plank bridge.We saw water- cress growing.This stream started at a spring in the fields to the north and ran southwards to join the River Avon. To the south were the farm buildings of Withies Farm,still surrounded by the remains of the withies which gave it its name.The surrounding fields had been cut for hay,others had cows graz -ing in them.Beyond the Burnett Ridge the fields are used for cereal crops.
